intro: Trichogonia menthifolia var. calva, commonly known as the smoothleaf trichogonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The leaves and stems are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild aromatic properties.
